Description: Hemispherical pottery bowl with rounded base made of dense Nile silt with organic inclusions. The exterior is ‘finger rippled’ with diagonal finger impressions made during manufacture. There are also areas of smoke discolouration. One side of the rim is pushed in and a knob of clay has been added on the interior below this point. Interior is roughly smoothed.
Curator's comments: Smooth Brown ware SC29P in Brunton and Caton Thompson 1928.
Bibliographic references: Brunton & Caton-Thompson 1928 / The Badarian Civilisation and Predynastic Remains near Badari (p. 12; pl. xvii.SB9P)
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
